title: Can I use 'that' instead of 'where'? - Quora

response.answer_text: I just do not know how you can replace where with that. What about which? Where did you buy that book? That shop? Pointing to a shop where they sell books. Which shop? Where… you are looking for something you have lost? Now where did I put that book? Put” that” into those questions. Does it make sense? Someone will probably correct me on this, but I gave it a go and that is all one can do which I have.

No, they have different meanings. Even in situations where either word could fit and make a grammatical sentence, the sentences would mean two different things. For example: “That is my dad” is a statement that the person that you are speaking about is your father.“Where is my dad?” is a question asking for information about your father.

Throw me a bone here. I need an example in which you are considering this substitution. In other words “where” is it you want to use “that”? Let’s try it as you wish to know: In other words, “that” is it you want to use “where”? Doesn’t work on that one.
It’s as simple as answering this: does saying where is it or that is it sound correct when you’re trying to say where is it?
